adjectives.description: coercive (comparative more coercive, superlative most coercive)

entries.meaning: Displaying a tendency or intent to coerce.
examples: The Bush administration is studying options for military strikes against Iran as part of a broader strategy of coercive diplomacy to pressure Tehran to abandon its alleged nuclear development program, according to U.S. officials and independent analysts.

entries.meaning: (mathematics, of a function F) Such that the ratio of |F(x)| to x approaches infinity as x approaches infinity.
